intro: Lepidium fenestratum, commonly known as the fenestrated peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and hairy, alternate leaves. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Lepidium fenestratum is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local insect populations.
